messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: audio files
messages.msgSnippet: I ll move one of those to another page so browsers with autoplay can do one at a time. If your browser starts them automatically (they are set to be quiet
messages.messageBody:
I'll move one of those to another page so browsers with autoplay can
do one at a time.

If your browser starts them automatically (they are set to be quiet
until someone clicks play), then mute it while you read and then
reload the page for it to start over if you want to listen. I'll go
and change that now. Easier for me to do that than for people to use
different browsers!!

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] audio files
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Sandra, They do both autoplay simultaneously when you use the chrome browser. Perhaps there may be a way to embed them to be more cross-browser friendly? Or
messages.messageBody:
Hi Sandra,

They do both autoplay simultaneously when you use the chrome browser.
Perhaps there may be a way to embed them to be more cross-browser friendly?

Or perhaps add in a line there to change browsers if they start playing at
the same time.

Vidyut

On Mon, Mar 1, 2010 at 11:23 AM, Vidyut Kale <wide.aware@...> wrote:

> "Second, I went to this site: http://sandradodd.com/parentingpeacefully to
> listen to the audio file, and it automatically started playing, but there
> were two conversations happening at the same time."
>
> The same happened with me. The files are set to autoplay or something.
>
> I think you are using the chrome browser. Use firefox to watch the page and
> they will play one by one. You can also download the audios to listen at
> leisure. They are longish, and contain loads of stuff I'd like to hear more
> times, so downloading them each time through the page doesn't make sense.
>
> That is what I tried. Both ideas worked.
>
> Vidyut
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] audio files
messages.msgSnippet: Second, I went to this site: http://sandradodd.com/parentingpeacefully to listen to the audio file, and it automatically started playing, but there were two
messages.messageBody:
"Second, I went to this site: http://sandradodd.com/parentingpeacefully to
listen to the audio file, and it automatically started playing, but there
were two conversations happening at the same time."

The same happened with me. The files are set to autoplay or something.

I think you are using the chrome browser. Use firefox to watch the page and
they will play one by one. You can also download the audios to listen at
leisure. They are longish, and contain loads of stuff I'd like to hear more
times, so downloading them each time through the page doesn't make sense.

That is what I tried. Both ideas worked.

Vidyut


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: audio files
messages.messageBody:
<<<Maybe you could click just below that to go to the internet archives and download your own files straight onto your computer, and then listen to them however you'd listen to anything on your computer.
(Bypass my webpage?)>>>

Thanks. I clicked on http://www.archive.org/details/PeacefulParentingTalkdoddprystowsky and was able to play it from there, without downloading anything to my computer.


> Did you see this?
> http://sandradodd.com/listen

No I didn't, but I'll explore it now. Thanks!

Pamela

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] audio files
messages.msgSnippet: -=Second, I went to this site: http://sandradodd.com/ parentingpeacefully to listen to the audio file, and it automatically started playing, but there were two
messages.messageBody:
-=Second, I went to this site: http://sandradodd.com/
parentingpeacefully to listen to the audio file, and it automatically
started playing, but there were two conversations happening at the
same time. I was hearing a man's voice and a woman's voice at the same
time. I'm not sure if there's a problem with the page, or if the
problem is with me <g> but I can't seem to figure out how to play one
conversation at a time. Clicking on the "bars" at the bottom didn't
help.-=-

They're not set to come on automatically.
Maybe you could click just below that to go to the internet archives
and download your own files straight onto your computer, and then
listen to them however you'd listen to anything on your computer.
(Bypass my webpage?)

Did you see this?
http://sandradodd.com/listen

Some of those lead to some other things.


Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: audio files
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, I m writing about two things... First, I am really interested in listening to unschooling stuff online, while I m working at my desk. I ve already explored
messages.messageBody:
Hi,

I'm writing about two things...

First, I am really interested in listening to unschooling stuff online, while I'm working at my desk. I've already explored You Tube, and did a search for "audio files" on Sandra's website (where I was led to the link mentioned below). If there are any other recommendations or links for listening, I'd love to hear them.

Second, I went to this site: http://sandradodd.com/parentingpeacefully to listen to the audio file, and it automatically started playing, but there were two conversations happening at the same time. I was hearing a man's voice and a woman's voice at the same time. I'm not sure if there's a problem with the page, or if the problem is with me <g> but I can't seem to figure out how to play one conversation at a time. Clicking on the "bars" at the bottom didn't help.

Thanks in advance, from someone who's reading and learning lots :-)
